entry.title: Expose effects processor from MediaEffectsService up to content client
entry.content:
Additionally, add unit tests for VideoEffectsProcessor that mostly

mimic the tests that have been written for Video Effects Manager. This

also includes a basic fake implementation of VideoEffectsService and

VideoEffectsProcessor.



MediaEffectsService header file also now exposes a way to override the

VideoEffectsService for testing, as otherwise it'd have to spawn a new

utility process, and this is not desired in unittests.



Bug: b:328118837

entry.title: Revert "[QuickStart][OOBE] Bug fixes on network screen"
entry.content:
This reverts commit abec508ec03662a70194aafa6485f4709e582a92.



Reason for revert: Suspect this broke QuickStartBrowserTest.EndToEndWithEmptyWifiCreds



Sample failure log:

024-03-26T19:37:47.953153Z VERBOSE1 browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [wizard_controller.cc(3010)] AdvanceToScreen user-creation

2024-03-26T19:37:47.953317Z VERBOSE1 browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [wizard_controller.cc(2864)] SetCurrentScreen: user-creation

2024-03-26T19:37:48.052577Z ERROR browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [auto_enrollment_type_checker.cc(205)] Kill switch config request failed with code -102

2024-03-26T19:37:48.052765Z WARNING browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [auto_enrollment_controller.cc(237)] Starting auto-enrollment controller.

2024-03-26T19:37:48.055312Z ERROR browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [auto_enrollment_controller.cc(185)] Failed to retrieve firmware management parameters.

2024-03-26T19:37:48.055419Z WARNING browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [auto_enrollment_type_checker.cc(517)] Auto-enrollment disabled.

2024-03-26T19:37:48.055443Z WARNING browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [auto_enrollment_controller.cc(529)] New auto-enrollment state: No enrollment

2024-03-26T19:37:48.958545Z VERBOSE1 browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [wizard_controller.cc(1946)] Wizard screen network-selection exited with reason: Connected

2024-03-26T19:37:54.008532Z ERROR browser_tests[1612997:1613031]: [external_metrics.cc(224)] Failed to create DirReaderPosix. Cannot read per-pid uma files.

2024-03-26T19:37:48.958646Z FATAL browser_tests[1612997:1612997]: [wizard_controller.cc(1952)] Check failed: current_screen_->screen_id() == screen.

#0 0x7f7062f3960c base::debug::CollectStackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:1039:7]

#1 0x7f7062ef1045 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:229:20]

#2 0x7f7062ef0fd5 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:224:28]

#3 0x7f7062c2e590 logging::LogMessage::Flush() [../../base/logging.cc:703:29]

#4 0x7f7062c2e4d7 logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage() [../../base/logging.cc:694:3]

#5 0x7f7062bd9fd5 logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() [../../base/check.cc:166:3]

#6 0x7f7062bd9ff9 logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage() [../../base/check.cc:161:32]



Original change's description:

> [QuickStart][OOBE] Bug fixes on network screen

>

> Fix an issue on the network screen that caused a brief 'Network not

> available' error when adding WiFi credentials using QuickStart. A

> short artificial delay (2 seconds) was introduced between the moment

> when we are notified that we are connected and the actual

> transition to the next screen. This will ensure that the network screen

> remains showing the WiFi being transferred a bit longer.

>

> Also move the binding of the Mojo pipe for configuring the network

> from a method and into the screen's constructor. Previously, it

> would trigger a crash when attempting to set a network for the second

> time.

>

> Test: Browsertests & manual verification using Pixelbook & Pixel 7

>

> Bug: b/328677262

> Change-Id: Idf5f126a70a52799709d7da4a92aec647b4e5c6f

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366560

> Commit-Queue: Renato Silva

> Reviewed-by: Danila Kuzmin

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278415}

entry.title: Update components/attribution_reporting DCHECKs to CHECKs
entry.content:
This matches latest guidance and should help increase certainty that

these are not being hit in production. We delay this change being fatal

to M128 to allow some temporal leeway and avoid stability risks in case

they are hit. (This gives around four weeks to fix any issues from when

M125 Stable is released before Canary switches to M128.)



Change-Id: I8ace0ebfb9f4b203e9c976c0131d5990d7532cec

entry.title: Add meaning for Wallpaper Search Subject string
entry.content:
Currently the translations for "Subject" in the Wallpaper Search

dropdowns shares a tc id with several other strings that have a

context of "subject of an email" which uses a different word in some

languages. The documentation for grit says that settings a meaning can

prevent 2 strings of the same English word from having the same tc id.



Bug: 331335469

entry.title: Simplify extensions::BlobReader::BlobReadCallback
entry.content:
After https://crrev.com/575507, the callback never receives nullptr for

the data, so change the data type from std::unique_ptr to

std::string to match that behavior. Then the callback users can stop

worring that the data might be null, and BlobReader can avoid an

unnecessary memory allocation.



Change-Id: If9f03cddde2ded1af9122ac93e5010559c7417dd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5393439

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Lei Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278580}

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: Don't signal |flush_cb_| if there's pending work
entry.content:
This CL fixes a corner case where ToT signals |flush_cb_| (indicating

the flush caused by end_of_stream() is finished done) when there's

still work to be done in the |OUTPUT_queue_|.



This issue was found out by vp80-03-segmentation-1436.ivf, which is

composed of two different resolution I-frames. The second frame

causes a resolution change which itself causes a |CAPTURE_queue_|

reconfiguration. Since the second configuration is detected in a

background thread (in a blocking poll in WaitOnceForEvents()), it

races with running said |flush_cb_|.



Re-reading the spec [1] there's some wording about this:

"Any OUTPUT buffers queued by the client before the VIDIOC_DECODER_CMD()

was issued will be processed and decoded as normal. The client must

continue to handle both queues independently, similarly to normal

decode operation. This includes:



- handling any operations triggered as a result of processing those

buffers, such as the Dynamic Resolution Change sequence, before

continuing with the drain sequence,

- queuing and dequeuing CAPTURE buffers, until a buffer marked with

the V4L2_BUF_FLAG_LAST flag is dequeued,

"



I understood that the LAST buffer was held until all work was processed

and finalized but from the test vector above, I see the spec can be

read as: wait until |OUTPUT_queue_| is truly empty, then look for the

LAST buffer coming out of the |CAPTURE_queue_|. This is what this CL

does, and it seem to fix the race and still verifies all test vectors

on Hana and Trogdor (minus some vp8_comprehensive ones on hana which

is tracked in b/b/303864839)



[1] https://www.kernel.org/doc/html/v5.15/userspace-api/media/v4l/dev-decoder.html#drain



Bug: 329051390

Change-Id: I7c9a5c1b8a312fb46eefefa0fbdee89a9172258f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5398057

Reviewed-by: Nathan Hebert

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278558}

entry.title: Make used color scheme scrollbars respect browser setting preference
entry.content:
Used color scheme calculation for web content in Blink doesn't depend

on Chrome browser color mode settings. The only exception is the WebUI,

where the preferred color scheme is set track browser color scheme [1].



The UsedColorSchemeRootScrollbars feature ensures that root viewport

non-overlay scrollbars follow the user's preferred color scheme by

default. However, since browser color settings typically do not

participate in the preferred color scheme calculation, the feature can

lead to an inconsistent appearance for root scrollbars under following

conditions:

- the browser color setting is set to "Light",

- the OS setting is set to "Dark".



In such cases, root scrollbars follow the OS setting and are painted

dark, even if the browser UI appear light. This creates a

compatibility risk because a lot of pages do not specify color scheme

support (e.g., wikipedia).



To address this issue, the CL introduces the

browserPreferredColorScheme web setting. This setting allows access

to the browser color setting state during the calculation of the used

color scheme for scrollbars.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4605338



Bug: 328102503

Change-Id: Idd0f0bdac3569703d642bd7a50c979db6f1a4f25

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5386749

Reviewed-by: Yoav Weiss (@Shopify)

entry.title: Make iframe load error message accessible
entry.content:
The iframe load error message is set to visibility:hidden when the user

is not hovering their mouse over it. This causes screenreaders to not

read the text, which means that screenreader users can't access the

error message.



By replacing the visibility:hidden rule with opacity:0, screenreaders

should be able to read the text.



Fixed: 1496288

Change-Id: I8b64fdc0f46e15a9939120007517f7d7be795c43

entry.title: lacros: Re-enable TabDragging test DetachToOwnWindowFromMaximizedWindow
entry.content:
This test was disabled because it was failing intermittently with the

following error message:



Expected equality of these values:

"0"

IDString(new_browser->tab_strip_model())

Which is: "1"



...



Expected equality of these values:

"1"

IDString(browser()->tab_strip_model())

Which is: "0"



Here's how that happens:



1. The test creates the browser window, unmaximized.

2. The test tries to maximize the window.

3. The test adds a new tab to the window. There are now 2 tabs. The tabs

are numbered, 0 on the left, 1 on the right.

4. The test tries to get the global screen coordinates of the center of

the leftmost tab so that it can drag-detach it. Sometimes this

happens before the window is finished maximizing (which can happen

for Lacros because these tests were not written with Wayland's async

paradigm in mind) resulting in the local-to-screen transform being

incorrect.

5. The test tries to drag-detach the leftmost tab. If the race condition

described in the previous step occurred, the coordinates that the

test thinks are the center of the leftmost tab are wrong, and

coincidentally happen to fall on the rightmost tab, so the test

drag-detaches the rightmost tab instead of the leftmost tab.



Expected result: the new window has ID 0, the old window has ID 1.



Actual result: the new window has ID 1, the old window has ID 0.



This is fixed by waiting for the Wayland server to catch up after after

the maximize.



Bug: 40228994

Change-Id: Ifc5b62c900863a7555acbd283bfea54d9bd80036

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5379737

Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

Commit-Queue: Alex Yang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278511}

entry.title: [Default Nav Transition] Implement the cross-fade animation.
entry.content:
At the end of the invoke animation, we crossfade from the screenshot to

the new live page, by setting the opacity of the screenshot from 1 to

0. Note we don't change the opacity on the activer page to avoid colors

becoming momentarily brighter during crossfade.

entry.title: Android: Remove some StrictModeContext in //chrome
entry.content:
This CL removes the simple usages of StrictModeContext in //chrome.

Since //chrome code is not shared with webview, this should have no

impact on webview's CTS tests.



The StrictModeContext try statements and its corresponding closing

braces were removed programmatically and then `git cl format` was run

until it no longer made edits.



Some harder ones that involve catch/finally blocks will be handled in

later CLs.



Manual edits: https://crrev.com/c/5392105/3..4



Also remove StrictModeWatch to prevent increasing the number of uploads

or StrictMode violations displayed locally.



Bug: 40286080

entry.title: Revert "Bookmarks: fix restore focus after delete"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 816fefa3fc736ee8d4cef05eeb997d2d7ab445fb.



Reason for revert: Likely culprit for recent Mac failures, example: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac13%20Tests/10545



Original change's description:

> Bookmarks: fix restore focus after delete

>

> A prior CL subtly changed focus behavior for

> chrome://bookmarks when deleting bookmarks. Other WebUIs can

> batch store property updates together, but list.ts relies on

> specific property update order in order to maintain focus.

> list.displayedIds_ must be updated first before

> list.selectedItems_, as onDisplayedIdsChanged_ requires

> accessing the old list.selectedItems_ value.

>

> Prior CL:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4763926

>

> Now that bookmarks is the only consumer of

> //ui/webui/resources/cr_elements/store_client and all ash

> usages have been migrated to

> //ash//webui/common/resources/cr_elements/store_client,

> restore the original sequential property update behavior.

>

> Bug: b:40075477

> Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=*BookmarksTest.List*

> Change-Id: I417720e10332cb6b8f46cf55c9cb6859c42a2d06

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5388959

> Reviewed-by: John Lee

> Commit-Queue: Jeffrey Young

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1278354}

entry.title: Simplify app-region/Draggable Region implementation
entry.content:
This change restructures how draggable regions are sent to the

browser. App-region is a main-frame-only concept, so instead of

plumbing through generic frame interfaces, this CL plumbs through

local-main-frame interfaces, which avoids ad-hoc IsMainFrame()

security checks.



More details in the "In progress changes" section of:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TztHzeWy7aFgjspfP6BbTd59OOmr5i7eCgi9fVCi_zo/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: [extended-updates] Implement Extended Updates settings logic
entry.content:
The main show/hide logic is determined by whether the device/user is

eligible to opt-in and that the device is currently up to date.



Eligibility is determined by logic in the extended updates controller in

the browser process, which the renderer calls via the browser proxy.



Three pieces of information from the update engine affect the

eligibility: whether the device is eol, whether the extended updates

date is passed, and whether the device requires user opt-in. These are

passed to the controller via the browser proxy when determining

eligibility.



The device being up-to-date is determined by updates having been checked

and the update status being UPDATED.



A policy observer is also added to be notified when a user has opted in.

This will update the UI to no longer show the option to opt-in.



Bug: b:322418004

Change-Id: I56dfc3a8c88659f192b0a98c824b917d59877de6

entry.title: Simplify chrome_pdf::ScopedSdkInitializer
entry.content:
ScopedSdkInitializer has an IsSDKInitializedViaPlugin() call that

assumes the call can return true, and skip SDK initialization. This may

have been possible about a decade ago, but modern //pdf code separates

the two types of use cases, as enforced by `public` headers in

//pdf/BUILD.gn:



1) Blink plugin code only run in PDF renderer processes, via

//pdf/pdf_view_web_plugin.h.

2) Various utilities only run in service processes and tests, via

//pdf/pdf.h.



As such, ScopedSdkInitializer is only used in //pdf/pdf.cc, so it only

has to deal with uses cases of type (2). Without any type (1) overlap,

IsSDKInitializedViaPlugin() should always return false.



Change-Id: Idff67d6283d8f6229c5d3e84c7c72f4cd799cce7

entry.title: Refresh app-bound encryption metrics and re-enable them.
entry.content:
The data format for encryption and decryption has changed, as

well as a few issues being resolved.



In order to gather even more data, this CL changes the pref name

(again) and wipes existing data (again) in order to get a full

Encrypt and Decrypt cycle from all clients.



Existing metrics are also renamed to ensure it is possible to

distinguish clients running the newest code from older ones.



Finally, the metrics are enabled by the feature in chrome/browser.



BUG=41493095

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.PathValidation histograms were all replaced by versions with '2' appended to them.

entry.title: Android: Turn off StrictMode.ThreadPolicy
entry.content:
The vast majority of StrictModeContext suppressions are for disk IO,

which is a ThreadPolicy violation. Turning this off in //chrome improves

performance (see https://crbug.com/40279700).



StrictModeContext should still be used in WebView-only code and

WebView-shared code with Chrome.

entry.title: Upgrade aggregation_service DCHECKs to CHECKs, not fatal until M128
entry.content:
This matches latest guidance and should help increase certainty that

these are not being hit in production. We delay this change being fatal

to M128 to allow some temporal leeway and avoid stability risks in case

they are hit. (This gives around four weeks to fix any issues from when

M125 Stable is released before Canary switches to M128.) We do not

upgrade DCHECK_CALLED_ON_VALID_SEQUENCE() as there is no CHECK

equivalent. We also avoid the "not fatal" parameter for code that is not

used in production.

entry.title: [iOS][Bookmarks] Editor deals with deleted ancestor.
entry.content:
If the node is deleted, the editor is closed.



If the bookmark or folder was going to be moved to a deleted folder

(including by signing-out), the node is moved to Mobile Bookmarks, if

possible of the same model.



This ensure:

* that both kind of editors behaves in a similar way

* that "done" is never ignored (which used to be the case when a node

was moved to a deleted folder

* that if the node is actually deleted, it’s reflected in the view.

entry.content:
While switching usage of Pickle to new creation factories, some usages

were switched to owning the data. This might not have been completely

clear to those OKing the switch, so this CL moves those invocations to

use the non-owning varieties, which matches the behavior of the code

before.

driver for the ability to create a Pickle that owns its data in the

first place.

entry.title: canvas: adds PaintOp for arcs, and uses it from CanvasPath
entry.content:
CanvasPath gets another builder for arcs, and BaseRenderingContext2D

special cases this type (similar to lines). This helps cases that

repeatedly draw a number of arcs because SkPath::arcTo() is quite

expensive.



This results in some rendering differences. I ran these by Victor

who thought they seemed reasonable.



Note that Yi had done a prototype of this a while back. This work

is based off it.

entry.title: [QuickStart][OOBE] Bug fixes on network screen
entry.content:
Fix an issue on the network screen that caused a brief 'Network not

available' error when adding WiFi credentials using QuickStart. A

short artificial delay (2 seconds) was introduced between the moment

when we are notified that we are connected and the actual

transition to the next screen. This will ensure that the network screen

remains showing the WiFi being transferred a bit longer.



Also move the binding of the Mojo pipe for configuring the network

from a method and into the screen's constructor. Previously, it

would trigger a crash when attempting to set a network for the second

time.



Test: Browsertests & manual verification using Pixelbook & Pixel 7

entry.title: Decouple HistogramController from content internals.
entry.content:
As a first step towards adding support for histograms in (Mac) App

Shims using the existing child process histogram fetching support,

this CL refactors HistogramController to no longer depend

on any content internals. Since content doesn't know anything about

app shims, any functionality needed will need to be exposed via

content/public or components/metrics.



See https://docs.google.com/document/d/19dANu83w-9q-Ft5PU1cxDHiKdZv4hDLyAdr2Zf3JgSc/edit?usp=sharing for more background.

entry.title: Revert "Reapply "Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS""
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3ec80b2b35407e54a8ece4fc55c05ab3dc2af032.



Reason for revert: Crashes on linux



Original change's description:

> Reapply "Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS"

>

> This reverts commit b1646bfdf2c9f2bbe91c5124ea20deb92793c38d.

>

> This change was reverted due to problems with LaCros. Reapplying with a

> flag so that it doesn't by default apply to LaCros. If the flag is

> disabled then the previous behavior is maintained (choose the Component

> Updated version only if it is greater than the bundled version.)

>

> Original change's description:

> > Enable Widevine CDM rollback on Linux/ChromeOS

> >

> > Component Update allows for downgrading components to an earlier

> > version. However, on Linux and ChromeOS, the Widevine CDM needs

> > to be loaded before the zygote is locked, and thus uses a hint

> > file to determine which version is supplied by Component Update.

> > Current checking in cdm_registration uses the larger of the bundled

> > version or the Component Updated version (if both exist), so if the

> > downgrade is to a version prior to the current bundled version, the

> > rollback doesn't work.

> >

> > To fix this, the hint file created when a new component is downloaded

> > is updated to keep track of the bundled version at the time it was

> > downloaded, as Component Update will check the bundled version when

> > determining if a new version is required. If the bundled version

> > matches this saved version, then the bundled version is skipped when

> > checking what should be loaded into the zygote (thus always loading

> > the Component Updated version).

>

> Bug: 41491028

> Test: manual test plus updated unit_tests pass

> Change-Id: I94d941e251f271653c7efad1009293c0bd597d93

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5381848

> Reviewed-by: Joshua Pawlicki

> Commit-Queue: John Rummell

> Reviewed-by: Xiaohan Wang

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1277842}



Bug: 41491028, 331282641
